metadata.title: CVE-2020-24352 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in QEMU through 5.1.0. An out-of-bounds memory access was found in the ATI VGA device implementation. This flaw occurs in the ati_2d_blt() routine in hw/display/ati_2d.c while handling MMIO write operations through the ati_mm_write() callback. A malicious guest could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service.

notes.note: mdeslaur> introduced in qemu 4.0 as of 2022-01-05, there is no upstream fix available for this issue. Possibly a dupe of CVE-2020-11869, see msg05720 url listed above.

criterions.comment: qemu package in hirsute is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-01-05').
